comments.body: `ConstExpressionSubset` needs to be a branch in `ElementValue`?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +353,357 @@      * ConstExpressionSubset        ::= Literal
      *                                | QualifiedName
      *                                | ClassLiteral
      *
      * We support only subset of const expressions expected in this context by java.

comments.body: This logic is similar to `array()`, an opportunity for reuse?

They are indeed similar. I've even spent some time trying to unify them when I first created them but the result is really not readable. One of these places allows trailing commas, the other does not. Also accepted terminating tokens are different. Moreover, they both need to be able to silently fail early, so it is not possible to use `repsep` or similar method.
Then it's fine to keep it as it is.

            args += annArg()
        accept(RPAREN)

      Option.unless(args contains None) {
